```
Title: [Project] Built a production data pipeline that processes 7M Yelp reviews in 2 hours

I created an end-to-end data engineering project that showcases:

**The Problem:** Processing millions of reviews in real-time is expensive. Naive implementations take 30-90 seconds per page load.

**The Solution:** A two-stage architecture:
- Offline: Batch ETL + pre-computation (run once/nightly)
- Online: Fast API serving (<100ms response times)

**Tech Stack:**
- Python 3.11, FastAPI, SQLite
- VADER sentiment analysis, TF-IDF keyword extraction
- K-Means clustering, Logistic Regression
- Vanilla JS frontend

**Performance Story:**
My initial implementation had N+1 query problems - would've taken 43 DAYS to process. After adding a single database index, it completed in 2 hours (500Ã— speedup).

**What's included:**
âœ… Full source code with documentation
âœ… Architecture diagrams (Mermaid)
âœ… Setup automation script
âœ… Performance optimization case study

The project is open source and well-documented for learning purposes.

GitHub: https://github.com/Anurag-Kumar9/yelp-insights-dashboard

Would love feedback from the community!
```

## ğŸ”„ Ongoing Maintenance (Weekly/Monthly)

### Weekly
- [ ] Respond to issues within 48 hours
- [ ] Review and merge PRs within 1 week
- [ ] Check GitHub Insights for traffic and engagement

### Monthly
- [ ] Update dependencies in requirements.txt
- [ ] Review and update documentation
- [ ] Check for security vulnerabilities
- [ ] Update CHANGELOG.md with new releases

### As Needed
- [ ] Add features based on community feedback
- [ ] Fix critical bugs immediately
- [ ] Engage with discussions
- [ ] Thank contributors

## ğŸ“Š Track Progress

Monitor these metrics in GitHub Insights:

- **Traffic:** Views, unique visitors, clones
- **Stars:** Star growth over time
- **Forks:** How many people are using it
- **Referrers:** Where traffic comes from
- **Popular content:** Most viewed files

**Goal Milestones:**
- [ ] 10 stars in first week
- [ ] 50 stars in first month
- [ ] 100 stars in 3 months
- [ ] First external contribution
- [ ] First issue from community
- [ ] Featured in a blog post / newsletter

## ğŸ¯ Success Indicators

Your repository is gaining visibility when you see:

1. âœ… Organic stars from users you don't know
2. âœ… Issues/questions from the community
3. âœ… Pull requests from external contributors
4. âœ… Mentions on social media or blogs
5. âœ… Forks for personal projects
6. âœ… Citations in academic work (via CITATION.cff)
7. âœ… Questions on Stack Overflow
8. âœ… Job interview discussions about the project
